dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5718 IH: SNAP Back Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Moore of Wisconsin introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To reinstate exemptions to SNAP work-requirements for homeless individuals, veterans, and former foster youth.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the SNAP Back Act of 2025.

section.header: Amendment to the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008
section.text: Section 6(o) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(o)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (F) by striking or at the end,
in subparagraph (G) by striking the period at the end, and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: an individual who is 24 years of age or younger and who was in foster care under the responsibility of a State on the date of attaining 18 years of age or such higher age as the State has elected under section 475(8)(B)(iii) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 675(8)(B)(iii)).
